description: A study of stellar structure and evolution with an emphasis on the physical principles underlyingthe observed phenomena. Topics include the birth, evolution, and death of stars, pulsars, blackholes, and white dwarfs. (Listed at Carleton as ASTR 232: Astrophysics I.)
name: Carleton: Astrophysics I
notes: Prequisites: completion of or concurrent registration in Physics 232.
Course will be taught at Carleton College by Professor Joel Weisberg.
